channel.title: Citrus Reticulata on funPlantGenes
channel.description: Recent content in Citrus Reticulata on funPlantGenes

item.title: CCD4b
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Ciclev10028113m.g Gene Symbol: CCD4b Gene Name: CAROTENOID CLEAVAGE DIOXYGENASE 4 Genome: Citrus clementina v1.

item.title: CcOMT1
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: CZG_jg17822 Gene Symbol: CcOMT1 Gene Name: O-methyltransferase Genome: Species: Citrus reticulata Functional Descriptions: Using multi-omics resources, we discover a putative caffeic acid O-methyltransferase (CcOMT1) that can transfer a methyl group to the 3-hydroxyl of natsudaidain to form 3,5,6,7,8,3’,4’-heptamethoxyflavone (HPMF).

item.title: CitSUS5
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CitSUS5 Gene Name: sucrose synthase 5 Genome: Citrus Genome Database Species: Citrus reticulata Functional Descriptions: Expression analyses and functional characterizations of CitSUS5 and CitSWEET6 support their proposed role in regulating fructose and glucose levels, hexose to sucrose ratio, and sucrose synthase cleavage activity.

item.title: CitSWEET6
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CitSWEET6 Gene Name: sugars will eventually be exported transporter 6 Genome: Citrus Genome Database Species: Citrus reticulata Functional Descriptions: Expression analyses and functional characterizations of CitSUS5 and CitSWEET6 support their proposed role in regulating fructose and glucose levels, hexose to sucrose ratio, and sucrose synthase cleavage activity.

item.title: CitZAT5
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CitZAT5 Gene Name: ZINC FINGER OF ARABIDOPSIS THALIANA Genome: Citrus Genome Database Species: Citrus reticulata Functional Descriptions: The transcription factor CitZAT5 modifies sugar accumulation and hexose proportion in citrus fruit.

item.title: CrBCH2
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CrBCH2 Gene Name: β-carotene hydroxylases 2 Genome: Species: Citrus reticulata Functional Descriptions: An R2R3-MYB transcription factor represses the transformation of α- and β-branch carotenoids by negatively regulating expression of CrBCH2 and CrNCED5 in flavedo of Citrus reticulate.

item.title: CrNCED5
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gene Symbol: CrNCED5 Gene Name: 9-cis-epoxycarotenoid dioxygenase 5 Genome: Species: Citrus reticulata Functional Descriptions: An R2R3-MYB transcription factor represses the transformation of α- and β-branch carotenoids by negatively regulating expression of CrBCH2 and CrNCED5 in flavedo of Citrus reticulate.
